DOC.HEADLINE: THE WEEK AHEAD : PARIS ; GERMANS BACK IN PARIS
DOC.TEXT: It ' s been 49 years and 11 months since the goose-stepping German army was driven from the streets of Paris by the Allies in World_War_II . Now , on Thursday , German soldiers will be back for the first time , marching down the Champs-Elysees as invited guests of the_French government in the annual Bastille Day parade . The participation of the German army in France ' s Republic Day festivities , barely a month after German leaders were shut_out of D-Day commemorations , is viewed by many in France as a chance to bury the past . An opinion poll conducted by Le Figaro newspaper last week found 58 % of the_French believe it is a good idea to let the Germans join the parade , as against 34 % who are opposed .
